instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
board came in no liquid damage but does not boot.  it had a busted cap on ppbus which i replaced and now i have ppbus but no boot.

ppbus - 8.58v
pp3v42 - 3.42
PM_SLP_S5_L - .003v
pp3v3_sus - 1.18v

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: What about 3V3_S5, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PM_BATLOW_L  and PM_SLP_SUS_L?

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
3V3_S5 - 2.018v
PM_DSW_PWRGD  - 0v
PM_BATLOW_L - 2v
PM_SLP_SUS_L - 0v

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: Post U7501 voltages; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
i noticed that u7501 was damaged (had a small hole in it) so i replaced it.
new voltages:
3v3_s5 - 3.3v
PM_DSW_PWRGD  - 3.4v
PM_BATLOW_L  - 3.3v
PM_SLP_SUS_L - 3.3v

u7501
23 - 8.58
12- 3.4
13 - 2
22- 3.3
29- 5
21- 3.4

still not getting fan spin

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_SUS now?
Any voltage on other coils, apart of L7560?

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
i have 3v3_sus now - 3.3v
i have no voltage on any large coils exepct l7560 and l7130

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L, at same time.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: PM_PWRBTN_L  drops when i trigger smc onoff

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: PM_SLP_S4_L should pulse at same time.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: PM_SLP_S4_L - its at 0v, but i get a pulse when smc onoff gets triggered

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
Then all S3 voltages must pulse too.
Also test if PM_SLP_S3_L pulse at same time.
If yes, check S0 voltages.
Be sure no short on coils, nor behind power FETs (page 58).

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
i get a pulse at PM_SLP_S3_L 
there are no shorts on large coils
i tested pp1v5_s0 and that pulses as well.
I will test the rest of s0 and s3 volatages as well as the fets

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: Don't forget to try SMC bypass...

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: with smc bypass i get fan spin for one second.  if i hit power button i get fanspin again for one second.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
i get pulse on
pp5v_s0
pp3v3_s0 - i have 2.1v.  I thought s0 only has power when unit is turned on, why am i getting stable 2.1v?  when i trigger i get 3.3v
pp1v5_s0

pp1v05_s0 - not getting pulse (diode mode on good board is .275, not working board is .215) maybe this is the issue line?
PPVCC_S0_CPU - not getting pulse

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
Can you confirm voltage at L7430/60, or pulse at least?
What about pins 7 & 3 of U1950?

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
L7430  i don't have any voltage but i do get pulse with smc onoff triggered
L7460 - Not on schematic L7560? - 3.3v
u1950 i don't have any voltage but i do get pulse with smc onoff triggered on both 7 and 3

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
Sorry, I meant L7630.
If pin 3/U1950 pulses, then CPU core voltage must pulse too.
Check for pulse at PLT_RESET_L at same time.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message:
i get a very small pulse at L7630 with the trigger, but if i unplug and replug power i get power on the coil for about 1 second.
i get pulse on  PLT_RESET_L

i rechecked  PPVCC_S0_CPU with plugging in and out and i do get power as well for one second.
i rechecked   pp1v05_s0 as well with plugging in and out and i do get power as well for one second.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: Check what happens removing U8130.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: removed u8130.  no fan spin. large coils still no voltage. what do you want me to check?

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: Is time to try known good BIOS.

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: pulled a u6100 from a working board.  still no fanspin, no power on any coils and smc bypass only single fanspin then off

threads.title: 00165 no boot
threads.message: No luck, should be bad CPU...
